page.title: 01Summmary of D-block 01920045
page.content: This D-block in mid-Cornwall is entirely{rural}in character. It includes the stretch of the River Fal between Grampound and Tregony, which was once navigable. The only amenities in the area are found in the northern third of Tregony included in this block. Similarly north Tregony is the only is the only centre of population. The block contains about 350 people. The main activity is{farming,}mostly dairying; there are about 27 farms in the block. { Topography:}Devonian sandstones and slates give rise to undulating relief up to 103m most of which drains to the Fal at about 12m. Patches of woodland are found on valley sides and typical Cornish hedges line the roads. Field boundary hedges are important animal and plant habitats. Churches appear unrelated to present population cover.
